samarkand.title: What are the benefits of studying in Samarkand State Medical University?

content.title: The study programs of the Samarkand State Medical University emphasize practical training. It helps the students to comprehend the concepts comprehensively. The campus has got top-notch facilities. Moreover, the institution has a scientific method library with more than 200,000 publications. This institution has partnerships and collaborations with many international organizations from various countries including the USA, Germany, Spain, and Holland. The other countries are Ukraine, Russia, Japan, South Korea, Kyrgyzstan, and Kazakhstan. There are faculty members in the University who have gone to other research centers and universities abroad to exchange their experience and undergo scientific study courses. There are teachers and professors in this University who are masters in their departments.

The Vision Medicos happens to be the official admission representative and partner of the Samarkand State Medical University. Indian students can get admission to the Samarkand State Medical University according to the most recent rules of the Medical Council of India. The authorities will select candidates with strong potential and proven academic excellence to become a physician. The eligibility criteria happen to be 10 + 2 in chemistry, physics, biology, and English with a minimum aggregate of 50% for the general category when it comes to practical and 40% for the reserved category. It is imperative for the students to have NEET qualifying marks during the present year of admission. The required qualifying marks are 134 for the general category and 107 for ST/SC/OBC categories.

samarkand.title: What is the condition of the hostels at the Samarkand State Medical University?

content.title: The Samarkand State Medical University is known to provide separate hostels for Indian girls. There are seven hostels in total. These hostels offer appropriate conditions for studying together with top-notch living conditions. These rooms have other required items such as pillows, blankets, and so on. These are furnished as well. There are rooms in all the hostels furnished with chairs and desks that will help the students to study properly. The hostels also include a canteen, laundry, library, fitness center, and billiard room. One can use the canteen in the Samarkand State Medical University for celebrating national holidays plus religious holidays of the different countries that belong to the students.

samarkand.title: What are the Samarkand State Medical University fees?

content.title: This University provides top-quality medical education at an affordable cost for Indian students. The fees are not only inexpensive, but the living standard is also cheap. The overall fees have been divided for the MBBS course at the Samarkand State Medical University in the following manner:  One can pay the tuition fee to the University account directly. One can also pay the fees in 2 installments of six months semester-wise. This fee structure is applicable for MBBS or General Medicine courses.
points: The tuition fee is $3200 every year.
The hostel fee is $650 every year.
content.titleAddon: One can pay the tuition fee to the University account directly. One can also pay the fees in 2 installments of six months semester-wise. This fee structure is applicable for MBBS or General Medicine courses.

samarkand.title: Why is the Vision Medicos so popular among the students?

content.title: In excess of 1000 MBBS Indian students have received guidance from the Vision Medicos over the years. This institution allows the students to save money by controlling overall expenses. The following are the main reasons why the Samarkand State Medical University stands above the rest:
points: It has a team of experienced, seasoned, and tested instructors.
It does not conceal any facts or truths.
It has a good knowledge of visa regulations, immigration regulations, and so on.
It does not charge any concealed expenses.
The Vision Medicos offers extremely detailed plus transparent suggestions and information.
It has an excellent system for supporting the students and parents.
There is a permanent office for the University for the last decade.

bukvonian.title: What courses does Bukovinian State Medical University offer?

content.title: 1) Masters in Medicine 2) Masters in Dentistry 3) Bachelor’s degree

bukvonian.title: What is the cost of living in Ukraine?

content.title: It is about Rs.60000 with all facilities.

bukvonian.title: Is there a sports or cultural facility at Bukovinian State Medical University?

content.title: 1) Masters in Medicine 2) Masters in Dentistry 3) Bachelor’s degree

bukvonian.title: Are there any donation charges for admission at Bukovinian State Medical University?

content.title: No, there are no extra charges for admission to Bukovinian State Medical University.

bukvonian.title: Is NEET required for admission at Bukovinian State Medical University?

content.title: Yes, a NEET scorecard is required for admission.

bukvonian-info.title: How is the accommodation arrangement and what are the charges?

content.title: The Bukovinian State Medical University Hostels are available for accommodation and it is included in the fee package. Students can stay in a University hostel. There are rooms with two or three beds, a common kitchen, and a common bathroom. Each room comes with tables, beds, and cupboards. Hostels are on the University campus. There is proper facility in each room of the hostel for self-studying as they are equipped with chairs, desks, and study tables. Several quarters are there that provide several amenities, such as cafeteria, laundry service, sports complex, gyms, and libraries. The hostel fee is approximately 500 USD per year.

bukvonian-info.title: Can we pay the tuition fee in installments?

content.title: The price of studying MBBS in Bukovinian State Medical University Ukraine is quite less compared with private medical colleges in other countries. The total cost of MBBS education for six years in Ukraine is about 16.25 Lacs. The fee split up for the MBBS course in Ukraine is as follows.
content.titleAddon: You can directly pay tuition fees at the university account. Moreover, the payment can be made in two instalments, semester wise. There is no hidden fee or donation incurred for MBBS admission in any Ukrainian medical university.

bukvonian-info.title: What are the charges for pursuing BDS/Dentistry?

content.title: The fee for pursuing BDS or Dentistry in Bukovinian State Medical University Ukraine is quite economical. The course is for 5 years. The tuition fee is 4300 USD per year. The hostel fee is 500 USD per year. So, the total amount is 4800 USD per year. You can pay tuition fees at the university account directly. Moreover, the payment can be made in two installments of 6 months, semester wise. There is no hidden fee or donation incurred for BDS or Dentistry admission in any Ukrainian medical university.

bukvonian-info.title: What is the fee for admission to the nursing course?

content.title: The fee for pursuing the nursing course in Bukovinian State Medical University Ukraine is quite cost-effective. The course is for 3 years. The tuition fee is 2000 USD per year. The hostel fee is 2500 USD per year. Thus, the total amount is 2800 USD per year. You can pay tuition fees at the university account directly. In addition, the payment can be made in two installments of 6 months, semester wise. There is no hidden fee or donation charge incurred for admission to the Nursing course in any Ukrainian medical university.

bukvonian-info.title: What is the Fee for Pursuing MBBS / GENERAL MEDICINE / MD PHYSICIAN Course?

content.title: The fee for pursuing the MBBS / GENERAL MEDICINE / MD PHYSICIAN course in Bukovinian State Medical University Ukraine is quite lucrative. The course is for 6 years. The tuition fee is 3900 USD per year. The hostel fee is 500 USD per year. Thus, the total amount is 4400 USD per year. You can pay tuition fees at the university account directly. In addition, the payment can be made in two installments of 6 months, semester wise. There is no hidden fee or donation charge incurred for admission to the MBBS / GENERAL MEDICINE / MD PHYSICIAN course in any Ukrainian medical university.

bukvonian-info.title: What are the eligibility criteria for admission to the MBBS universities in Ukraine?

content.title: No special examination is required for admission to the top medical universities in Ukraine for the MBBS courses. The Bukovinian State Medical University and other major government medical universities of Ukraine take admission based on the higher secondary marks (min 50% aggregate for the General category and 40% aggregate for the OBC/SC/ST) having Physics, Chemistry and Biology as compulsory subjects. The student must have qualified for the NEET examinations (as specified by the Medical Council of India). Examinations like IELTS, TOFEL, etc. are not required. The candidate must be at least 17 in the year of admission.

bukvonian-info.title: What are the documents required for admission?

content.title: The candidate must have an application form consisting of the candidate’s name, nationality, education, birth date, age and other details that must be filled online on the university’s website. Original and photocopy of the class 12th mark-sheet and admit card is needed which should be self-attested. The candidate must carry a copy of the passport and 6 photographs of the dimensions 3 x 4 cm. In the case of the reserved candidates, they must also carry their caste certificates (SC/ST/OBC). The NEET result card is also required to verify the eligibility.

bukvonian-info.title: What are the different courses offered by the medical universities of Ukraine?

content.title: There are many medical courses available in the top medical universities of Ukraine for undergraduate students from which the students can choose according to their field of interest. The top government medical universities of Ukraine such as the Bukovinian State Medical University offers the following medical courses for undergraduates.
points: MBBS (5.9 years that includes 1 year of internship).
BDS/Dentistry (5 years that includes an internship).

ukraine.title: How to apply for student Visa to Ukraine?

content.title: Student Visa application form is filled with the copy of call letter or admission letter of selected university. It is verified and offered to you within a week.
content.titleAddon: Applying for admission for MBBS in Ukraine is far easier. You have to keep your documents ready and follow the eligibility criteria. It is better to consult with experts at The Vision Medicos – an official admission partner of The Bukovinian State Medical University in Ukraine.

ukraine.title: Is the MBBS degrees from Ukraine recognized in India?

content.title: MBBS degree from Ukraine is recognized in India and more than 180 countries. You have to clear MCI Screening in India after completing your MBBS degree and start practicing.

ukraine.title: Are the medical colleges in Ukraine recognized?

content.title: Medical colleges and universities in Ukraine are recognized by MCI, WHO and different other government bodies.

ukraine.title: Are there Indian students studying MBBS in Ukraine?

content.title: More than 5000 students are studying MBBS and other degrees in Ukraine. Every year, a good number of students get admission in different universities for MBBS in Ukraine.

ukraine.title: What is the quality of education in Ukraine?

content.title: Quality of education is world-class for study MBBS in Ukraine or to pursue any other degree like MS or MD. The teacher student ratio in BSMU is 1:20 with clearing doubts in easy way.

ukraine.title: Why Studying MBBS In Ukraine Is Easy And Cost-Effective?

content.title: Due to having no entrance exam burden, study MBBS in Ukraine is easier. Fee is far easier and affordable that one can pay easily and in installments yearly. Admission procedure is far easier for MBBS in Ukraine that you can do without any entrance exam. Just keep your documents ready and apply for the seat in any recognized medical university like The Bukovinian State Medical University.

ukraine.title: Can we practice in India after studying MBBS in Ukraine?

content.title: Yes, you can practice anywhere in India after studying MBBS in Ukraine. But you have to clear a screening test from the Medical Council of India. We offer coaching to clear the Foreign Medical Graduates Examination (FMGE) by the MCI, to excel the exam easily. The coaching is offered through Rivansun careers, a joint venture of The Vision Medicos. This centre has its presence in New Delhi, Chandigarh, Hyderabad, and Trivandrum. Classes are also conducted at the Bukovinian State Medical University campus during the winter vacations. The results of the FMGE- MCI examinations have been tremendous and about 70 to 80% of the graduates clear this exam in their first attempt.

ukraine.title: How safe are the hostels at the BSMU university, Ukraine for students?

content.title: The Bukovinian State Medical University offers accommodation in government hostels only and it is the only university that offers a separate hostel for girl students. The hostels are block type buildings with corridors. The rooms will be shared by 2/3/4 students. Foreign students are made to stay in hostel no 2,5 and 7. Hostel No 4 is for girl students. The hostels render excellent living conditions and are peaceful for studying. All rooms are completely furnished and there is provision for leisure activities as well in the hostel. There is an Indian Café located inside the hostel and is been served by Indian cooks. There is also a special guest house for parents on the university campus.

ukraine.title: Am I eligible for an educational loan to pay for my graduation?

content.title: Yes, students can avail themselves of educational loans to fund for their graduation at the medical colleges in Ukraine. The Russian education system will offer the necessary documents that are required for applying for an education loan from both private and nationalized banks. We will guide the students across the entire process of loan application and approval. Students have to either pay from their pockets for the entire course or apply for the educational loan. They cannot work as they study to earn for paying their tuition fee. It is not allowed in Ukraine.

ukraine.title: Can I come to India during my holidays? How long is the vacation period?

content.title: Students studying MBBS in Ukraine will get their vacation in July and August. But most of the medical universities in Ukraine will expect the students to complete their hospital practice and training for the academic year during these vacations, as these are important parts of the medical curriculum. A very few universities can allow students to complete training in their native countries. In such instances, you can come home during your holiday. But most of the universities will expect the students to complete the training in university hospitals. It is better not to get home sick until the 5 years of MBBS study is completed.

ukraine.title: Why should I Choose The Vision Med to study MBBS in Ukraine?

content.title: The Vision Med has a success rate of above 99% in assisting students to gain MBBS seats in the Bukovinian State Medical University in Ukraine. Our students also attend the MCI coaching and clear the screening test in the first attempt to start practising in India. We have successfully graduated more than 1000 MBBS students from India, who are now practising either in India or abroad. We work with the best medical universities in Ukraine and strive towards the overall career growth of our students. Above all our charges are nominal and we genuinely guide students through the admission process.

uzbekistan.title: Why should I choose to study MBBS in Uzbekistan?

content.title: Many Indian students prefer to study MBBS in Uzbekistan as these universities render high-quality education, highly experienced teachers, and world-class teaching infrastructure. The country is also safe for Indian students and enjoys a favorable climate and living conditions

uzbekistan.title: What are the top MBBS colleges in Uzbekistan?

content.title: The best university in Uzbekistan to study MBBS for Indian students is the Samarkand State Medical University. The other best universities in the country that is favorable for Indian students are the Tashkent state medical institute, Andijan state medical institute, and the Bukhara state medical institute.

uzbekistan.title: What is the duration of the MBBS course in Uzbekistan for Indian Students?

content.title: The course duration of the MBBS degree in Uzbekistan for Indian students is 5 years + 1 Year Internship, which includes five years of learning and one year of internship. The one year of internship in the universities is added as part of the MBBS course duration in the country.

uzbekistan.title: How much should I spend on MBBS education in Uzbekistan?

content.title: The cost of MBBs education in Uzbekistan is roughly Rs. 12,00,000 to Rs. 20,00,000 INR for the entire study duration of five years. The yearly fees for Indian students are around INR 3,00,000. The fees include tuition fees and other academic-related costs.

uzbekistan.title: What are the common hostel facilities available for Indian students?

content.title: The accommodation fees are not included in the tuition fee and the amenities available for the Indian students are, clean and ventilated rooms with high-speed WIFI. Canteen facilities, 24/7 electrical supply, security, laundry, and housekeeping services are available with access to Indian food. There are separate hostel rooms for girl students.

uzbekistan.title: What are some of the reasons to study MBBS in Uzbekistan?

content.title: Some of the reasons to study MBBS in Uzbekistan include high quality of education, learning diagnostics, international standards, well experienced professors, high-class infrastructure, modern transportation and communication facilities, religious freedom, law defense, favorable climate, safe society, and easy availability of regular health insurance.

uzbekistan.title: What is the eligibility criteria for MBBS in Uzbekistan?

content.title: The eligibility criteria for MBBS in Uzbekistan includes completing the 10+2 examination with a percentage of 50% for general category students, being 17 years old as of 31st December of the year of admission, having Physics, Chemistry, and Biology as subjects, and clearing the NEET examinations.

uzbekistan.title: What is the student culture like in Uzbekistan for Indian MBBS students?

content.title: The student culture in Uzbekistan is diverse and welcoming for Indian MBBS students. Many international students, including those from India, choose to study MBBS in Uzbekistan. The universities have a mix of students from various countries, cultures and backgrounds, which makes for a rich and diverse student community. The universities in Uzbekistan also offer various extracurricular activities and events, which provide opportunities for students to interact with each other and learn about each other's cultures.

uzbekistan.title: What are some of the top medical universities in Uzbekistan?

content.title: Some of the top medical universities in Uzbekistan include Samarkand State Medical University, Bukhara State Medical Institute, Tashkent State Dental Institute, First Tashkent State Medical Institute, Second Tashkent State Medical Institute, Akfa University Medical School, and Fergana State University Medical Centre.

uzbekistan.title: Is Uzbekistan a safe country for Indian students?

content.title: Yes, Uzbekistan is generally considered a safe country for Indian students. The crime rate is low, and the government takes measures to ensure the safety of its citizens and foreign visitors. However, it is always important to take basic safety precautions and be aware of your surroundings, especially when traveling alone or at night.

uzbekistan.title: What is the process for obtaining a medical license after completing MBBS in Uzbekistan?

content.title: Yes, Uzbekistan is generally considered a safe country for Indian students. The crime rate is low, and the government takes measures to ensure the safety of its citizens and foreign visitors. However, it is always important to take basic safety precautions and be aware of your surroundings, especially when traveling alone or at night.
points: Verification of degree: International students need to get their MBBS degree verified by the Medical Council of India (MCI) or the respective medical council in their home country.

Licensing exam: International students need to take the licensing exam conducted by the respective medical council in their home country. In India, the licensing exam is called the Foreign Medical Graduates Examination (FMGE).
Internship: International students need to complete a one-year internship in a hospital in their home country.
Registration: After successfully completing the licensing exam and internship, international students need to register with the medical council in their home country to obtain their medical license.
content.titleAddon: It is important to note that the licensing process may vary depending on the country of origin, so students should check the requirements with the relevant medical council in their home country.

uzbekistan.title: What is The Vision Medicos and how can they help students with admission to medical universities in Uzbekistan?

content.title: The Vision Medicos is an organization that helps students with admission to medical universities in countries like Uzbekistan. They guide students for admission to top MCI result universities in Uzbekistan and work with the medical universities in Uzbekistan. They are the official representative of Samarkand State Medical University and have successfully placed more than 1000 students from all over India to top-ranked universities in Uzbekistan as well as in other countries. Students can get all the facts and details from their experienced career counselors.
